Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ugh, man. My delts are blasted. I wish they had a chart for how much protein powder to scoop for a 180 pound man with no fat.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Protein powder, huh? You cut it with water? Why don't you just take estrogen? [swallows powder] [coughs] There you go boys. See how papa takes care of you? [kisses bicep] Mwah.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I remember when people thought biceps were all that. They'd flex them all night at the discotheque.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, I bet you think it's all about core, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, please.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Core's critical. There are four tenets of pilates that I live my life by. One - lengthen. Two - elongate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen, guys, I think we all want to know the same thing, right? Who's the strongest? Well, there's only one way to solve that - flat curl contest.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, here we go everybody. May the manliest man win. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Feast on this, Lewis.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I love the burn. The burn is where I live.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Come on, Gabe, you can't handle his hamstrings. You're getting hypno-thigh-zed.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Speed set. One. Two.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here, this is for your elbows, for your elbows.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Five. Six.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Quick phone call from you guys, keep going,

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Eight, nine, ten.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: We got it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Very funny Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah, Jim. Way to mock us for perfecting our bodies.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Everyone, conference room, now. [Dwight and Gabe stand up, falling over]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, easy there, grandpa.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't need your help.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. You don't need my help?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Here, here... Just...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Morning.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Somebody left in such a hurry this morning that she forgot... these.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know the only thing more delicious than your feet is the feast that I am going to prepare for everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy, if you're gonna hang out for a while, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: This dumb rule Robert made, he just wants visitors to sign in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is this Robert's attempt to embarrass me?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, of course not. It's just - I think it's like if we make an exception for you, then we have to make an exception for the water guy, and then, it's like, where does it end? So just... [puts visitors tag on Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why is it when other people spend all their time at the office, they're rewarded for it, and when I do it, I am told it's a little much? ...Is it because I am not an employee anymore, because that's what it feels like.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, well, enjoy the alumni game.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good, we have a deal?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks Janet.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks so much Earl.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow, simultaneous sale.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And they said it couldn't be done. Boom!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Screw 'em.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Lot going on guys. What's happening?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Binghamton branch closed last night and their clients are up for grabs.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That was a fine branch. Things are really bad under Robert California, I guess. It's like a festival of poo.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, come on, language.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, and we're not interested in your sour grapes, okay? Jim, tell him where he can stick his grapes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In the fridge.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Jim, the butt, in his butt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sorry, man, I can't focus on zingers. There's too many potential clients.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You two better watch yourselves.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, the Syracuse branch can't be happy you're taking New York clients.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Shh... shh... [vomits in trash can]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Robert?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why did Binghamton close?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Can everyone just, please... I had a one-man saturnalia last night, in celebration of the finalization of my divorce. I got into a case of Australian reds, and - how should I say this - Columbian whites. What - what is this about, uh, Binghamton?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The branch closed. Forever.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Closing the Binghamton branch never occurred to me before today. Or, I guess, last night. But, in vino veritas as they say, I'm not gonna start doubting my drunken self now.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I got your voicemail. From - from last night.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Wonderful.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: And the answer... is yes, yes, yes, yes, and never. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Pam, when's the last time you lived so intensely that your brain literally couldn't hold the memories in?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, it was this summer -

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Apparently, I left a phone message for Nellie last night, and I need you to find out what I said.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um, I am a little busy.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yes, 'course. Why don't you list the things that would keep you from helping me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I can make you a list.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Let's do it now. What's number one?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why don't I help you now?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: There we go.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Andy cooking food by reception, Harry walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Who the hell are Jim Halpert and Dwight Schrute?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Jim, Dwight, what are your last names?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you are...

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Harry Jannerone, Dunder Mifflin Syracuse.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [shocked look from Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: What the hell's all this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, cherries jubilee over homemade gelato.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: You live well down here in P.A. I want to talk to you guys right now. Oh, and Lloyd Gross too. Which one's that guy?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The salesmen have a commission cap, but we figured out a way around it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Lloyd Gross is a fictional salesman we invented to - how do I put this - steal from the company. Embezzle. To commit fraud.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, it sounds sketchy, but it helps us get more money.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam made a drawing of Lloyd. He is a blend of all the salesman. [shows sketch]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [pointing at Toby] There he is. That's Lloyd.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Me?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yeah, you.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Where do you get off crossing state lines?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Now, we're actually a lot closer to Binghamton than you are. Kimosabe.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I like to think Lloyd Gross is a no-nonsense guy who doesn't back down from anybody. And he calls people "Kimosabe".

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: They're New York. We're New York. State line is the dividing line. That's the way it's always been.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There's actually not a rule that says that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's true.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: That's true. There's no rule. You can check the employee handbook.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Oh, can I check the employee handbook Lloyd? Well, does it say anything about me choking a man with my bare hands?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, no? Are you kidding me? You told me there was a rule. I could've choked so many people by now.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Stay out of my state. It's in your best interest to stay out of my state.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I've seen guys like you. Big guys who like to push the little guys around. Lloyd Gross eats bullies like you for breakfast.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Just stay out of New York, Lloyd.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, text from the old wife. Gonna take that. [runs outside]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How about this? How about we just ask Robert? Can we all agree that maybe the C.E.O should decide this?

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Robert's here. Look at us. Bickering like schoolgirls, looking around the room for things to hit each other with. I don't think we were doing that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Chair, lamp, plant, table leg, Jim's leg.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Where's the Advil, Jim? I think I've hit my limit on the Tylenol - Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Doing dishes] Sorry, not Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Andrew, what do we have to do to get rid of you? Hire you back and send Erin back to Florida?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Message received loud and clear. Just have to get the caramelized sugar off the pan before it dries.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh, for god -

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Robert California. What a surprise you're here in Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Harry...

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: So why would you close Binghamton down without a transition plan in place?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: How do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I forgot, a... a pan, uh -

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: No, no, no, no, no, kid, stay there, do your dishes, go ahead.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Harry there is a time for every decision, predetermined many years ago. There's no benefit in questioning why this particular decision seems... so poorly timed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, what are you deciding? We get a say.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Listen, Robert, I don't have time. There's a big client in play. Prestige direct mail solutions -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Don't listen to him.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Used to be Binghamton's -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: I want it, it's mine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Prestige is ours. Okay, they're responsible for half of the junk mail on the eastern seaboard. We get them. We already put a call into them, Robert.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: We need you to make a decision.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Make a decision.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: I have decided. Neither of you are to have any contact with either Prestige or any other Binghamton client until I have figured out how to divide things up. As Solomon once said... [Andy walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Some bizarre energy in this place today. Robert is going off the rails, making some funky decisions. Like why is nobody gonna call on Prestige? That is a huge client. [walking to car] I mean, they could give their business to the first person to walk in the door. Could be any idiot. Any idiot at all.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Shaping a company is, in a sense, similar to training a geisha. You have to mold not merely the physical form, but also the character. The two must harmonize. Are they still there? [camera pans to right, Harry, Dwight, and Jim watching Robert in conference room] They want a decision who gets the big client. Well, they can wait. I'll still be talking about geishas long past their bedtime. You know, I trained as one.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Is it just me or is our boss a freakin' weirdo? [stands up, walks outside] I'm gonna get some air.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, you know what would be really dastardly? If we snuck out of here and got to the client first.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Gets up and looks out Nellie's office window] He's running!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Damn it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wha - what is this supposed to be?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's a monkey.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, great real. This is not a monkey. It's got a hula skirt and a blue nose.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hold on, hold on. Is this him?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is that him?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's him! Do something! Get out!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? What am I gonna do? I don't -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go slash his tires! Go dent his hood. [Jim opens passenger door] That's it? Oh, that's great. That's like a five second delay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, let's go! Does this thing have turbo? Nitrous? Hit the nos.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nos? You mean like in fast and furious?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, definitely have nos.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hit the nos.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you sure?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Brace yourself. 3... 2...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Got it. Go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: 1. Here we go! [turns on wipers]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hello. Andy Bernard to see the C.E.O.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Oh, do you have an appointment?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, I do not.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Okay, I think I can squeeze you in.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Seriously? 'Cause I could just be anyone. I mean, I thought I was gonna have to convince you.

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: He's really not that busy.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Is there someone here to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Receptionist
Quote.Text: Yes, this man.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Come on in. [Andy walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So...what do you make of this Robert California guy? I mean, what does a guy like that do on an average weeknight?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh. Oh, I'll tell you what he does.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: : [walks in] Hello! Hello, my clucking hens. Got room for another in the roost? Huh? Don't worry, I won't lay an egg.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: : Robert sent me to take over if Pam fails. If? [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: : I have been crunching numbers all day. Math is for boys. I need girl talk.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Did someone say girl talk?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Sometimes I wonder if I have ovaries in my scrotum, because I am great at girl talk.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Have you guys been watching any good Korean soap operas? I'm pretty deep into Hee-Jungcinderella girl. Although, I definitely fast-forward through the young-Tae storylines.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Do you think I'd like that, or is it important to have an Asian fetish?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Uh, I think you're gonna need to have an Asian fetish. Yeah. [chuckles] It'll be upsetting if you don't.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm a former paper executive. I know the product. I know the margins. I can save you 25% on your costs.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Why haven't I heard of you? You got any references?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No. I'm a rogue.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Which is the best part. That means you will be my first customer and your business will get 100% of my attention. Now... [pulls out business card] I have written down my personal phone number. You call this anytime.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Every salesman I've ever met has given me his personal phone number.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Of course they have. Which is why I'm giving you a key to my house. [gives key to C.E.O] Whatever you need - anytime, night or day - you just stop on by.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: You want me to drive to your house if I need paper.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Maybe you just want someone to talk to. Maybe... you need a place to crash for a couple of days. My wireless password is eat pray love. Easy to remember.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ready? Go! Go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go, go. [takes off belt, ties doors together]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Running] Ahhh! [Slides into elevator]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You all right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. [Doors about to close, hand stops them] Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah! [Harry walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Dwight pushes button for floor two] Dwight, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Go, go! Take the stairs! Now!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just run! Take the stairs!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't even know where the stairs are!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll stall him. Go!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: God!

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: [Dwight jumping] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna activate the seismic failsafe. We'll be stuck between floors for hours. [pants fall down] Oh. [Jim runs in] My pants fell down.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My pants fell down! I don't have a belt!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [walks into lobby] Hello, sir. Good day. Dwight K. Schrute. Dunder Mifflin, Scranton. Forgive my pants, they fell down. An appointment with Mr. Ramish, please. Right now is fine. No, no, no, I was here first. Dwight K. Schrute. Dunder Mifflin, Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well -

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Mr. Ramish, Harry Jannerone. Dunder Mifflin, Syracuse -

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I was here first.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I already made an appointment... with your secretary.

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Let me stop you all right here. I've already picked a new paper supplier.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, it's not D.M Utica, is it?

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: No, no, it's not Dunder Mifflin at all actually. It's... Big Red Paper Company.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Big Red Paper Company?

Quote.Speaker: Mr. Ramish
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yes, yes, yes!

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Give me a cup of coffee.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Me too. Or do you also have a monopoly on thirst?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, guys. It didn't work out for any of us, so... we're still on the same team. Let me get these.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Let him get his own. It's Syracuse money.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: You know, your partner's got a lotta attitude. But I like that. How long you guys been dating?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim couldn't land me in a thousand years.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But you're saying there's a chance.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Shut up.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Walks into conference room] Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I stole Nellie's phone.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Excellent. Excellent. Though troubling that your first instinct is thievery.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you want from me?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Now we get to the bottom of Nellie's "yes, yes, yes, yes, never."

Quote.Speaker: Phone
Quote.Text: Hi, Nell, it's mom. Do keep your chin up. It can't be as bad as you described.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Oh yes it can.

Quote.Speaker: Phone
Quote.Text: This is MasterCard. You are over the limit. Send the minimum payment of $448 by Monday, or we will be forced to send it to collections.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Shopaholic.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sounds like it.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phone
Quote.Text: Hi, sis. Is your boss still hitting on you?

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Phone
Quote.Text: This is Annie from second nests. I'm sorry, but the Romanian orphanage felt more comfortable with a two-person nuclear family than a single mother, so, we're gonna hold out for that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, that's enough. [grabs phone]

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Pam, we need to get to the bottom of this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, no!

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: No, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Robert! Okay, oops! I deleted them all. They're all deleted.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Pam, Pam, you've completely bungled this!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah. Ahh. [walks out]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Can I do it, Pam? Can I put off a gold Arabian sandal?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... yes. Definitely. With your hair -

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Certainly. Um... you dropped your cell phone.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, gosh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Thank you. I'm... so stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No. My goodness. You have a lot going on. With Robert and everything.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, god, Pam. Don't get me started.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, I will not.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: You've just got me started. Robert... is... a filthy beast. I mean, don't you get the feeling, he's just thinking of fifteen different ways to do you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well -

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I mean, the man talks of nothing but sex.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But sometimes he talks about flesh... and bacchanals.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I cannot even tell you what he left on my phone last night.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No... don't. Just put it out of your mind.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Pam, what is your address? I'm gonna send you a pair of these gold harem shoes. Oh, no. You don't -

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh yes. Come on, a little gold Arabian slipper.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Things are looking up. I might be a mother soon. I have MasterCard right where I want them. And... I have a new friend. A friend. At work.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: [Erin opens door] Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: There's a call for you on line one.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He says salvation. No last name.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Yeah, hello?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [in car] You once put me on a list of the losers in the office. Well, this loser just got your biggest client to give him all their business. So hire me back, that business is yours. Don't, and I will find another buyer.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: You're blackmailing me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's just business.

Quote.Speaker: Robert
Quote.Text: Ah, well, I will not be blackmailed by some ineffectual, privileged, effete, soft-penised debutante. You wanna start a street fight with me, bring it on. You're gonna be surprised by how ugly it gets. You don't even know my real name. I'm the *bleep* lizard king. [disconnects]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa. Well I gave him a chance. [gets out of car, walks to house]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: [opens door] Andy Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You got a minute?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Um... I'm in the middle of a piano lesson.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wanted to see if I could interest you in an investment. Dunder Mifflin.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin. [closes door] Now... why would I want that? It's worth half of what it was three years ago.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Exactly. And you know better than anyone that with the right management it could be worth twice what you would pay for it today.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Why don't you come in? [Andy walks in, closes door]

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: So what would you do if you weren't selling paper?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, man, I'd have to sell beets. Probably submit them for competitions.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah! I know it sounds stupid, but nationals has always kinda been a dream of mine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How have we never talked about this before? Wait. You don't even care about nationals.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Nothing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. I've always wanted to own a bike shop, but what about you?

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: I'd like to sell one big thing, you know? Like... a plane. One sale, I'm out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That sounds lovely.

Quote.Speaker: Harry
Quote.Text: Anyway, Robert's gonna run this company into the ground, so... We won't be doing this in six months.
